purpose: Introduce the concept of Lifecycle Management (LCM) and its phases.
title: What is Lifecycle Management (LCM?)

bullets.text: Cardholder lifecycle management (LCM) is the end-to-end, holistic strategy to drive top-of-wallet card status and maximize portfolio profitability over time
Lifecycle management covers the entire customer journey of activating newly acquired accounts to developing and retaining profitable customers in the portfolio

The lifecycle generally includes four key phases - Acquisition, Onboarding/Early Month on Book (EMOB), Usage, and Retention - which are built on a foundation of a strong issuer brand and card value proposition, and must be supported by consistent messaging and data-driven segmentation throughout the phases

bullets.highlight: Each phase of the lifecycle requires different focus
bullets.text: Each phase of the lifecycle requires different focus, approach, and metrics to fulfill the cardholders needs, drive actions, and optimize the engagement to generate the desired business outcomes
